documentation.text:
@dev Returns whether bet is within range of minimum and maximum
 allowable bets

@dev Returns whether a winning bet can by paid out by machine. Balance of
 machine must be at least (value of bet * payout).

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Contract has insufficint funds to payout possible win."

arguments.value: Contract has insufficint funds to payout possible win.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Contract has insufficint funds to payout possible win."

documentation.text: @dev Creates a Game record, which is updated as game is played.

@dev If game is ready to be played, but random number not yet generated,
 this function may be called. Limited to only when bet is placed to avoid
 over-calling / over-spending Link since random number is generated with
 each call of this. replayGame() may be called by owner in cases of "stuck"
 or unplayed games.

@dev Requests a random number, which will be returned through the
 fulfillRandomness() function.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Contract balance too low to play"

arguments.value: Contract balance too low to play

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Contract balance too low to play"

documentation.text:
@dev Called by Machine Coordinator only once number is generated. Gas reserves are
 refilled here so they can be cleared for gas savings when next bet is placed.
@dev Returns summary of machine requirements for play and payout multiplier.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Game already complete. No refund possible."

arguments.value: Game already complete. No refund possible.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Game already complete. No refund possible."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Contract balance too low. Please try again later."

arguments.value: Contract balance too low. Please try again later.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Contract balance too low. Please try again later."

documentation.text:
@dev Request a refund for an unplayed game. If game is created, but
 machine conditions are not appropriate to allow play, no number will
 be generated and player or authorized address can request refund.
 Regardless of who requests refund, payout will always be to player
 listed in game.

@dev Withdraw specified amount of ETH from machine. Amount must be less than
 any unplayed bets in machine to allow for refunds.
@dev Withdraw specified amount of LINK from machine.

@dev Add any address as authorized user. Can be used to whitelist other contracts
 that may want to interact with authorized functions.

@dev Updates the address to which all withdrawals of ETH & LINK will be sent. If
 machine is closed (all funds withdrawn), this address receives all available funds.

@dev Withdraws all available funds from the machine, leaving behind only
 _unplayedBets, which must remain for any refund requests. This does not
 do anything to halt operations other than removing funding, which
 automatically disallows play. If machine is re-funded, play may continue.

@dev Used to create a LuckyMachine that can be verified and included in the
 factory list.

@dev Returns a list of all machines created from this factory. Useful to verify
 a machine was setup appropriately and is a "legitimate" LuckyMachine.
@dev Returns a list of all machines created by the sender.

 machine must be at least (value of bet * payout).

 each call of this. replayGame() may be called by owner in cases of "stuck"
 or unplayed games.

 Regardless of who requests refund, payout will always be to player

attributes.text:
@dev Withdraw specified amount of ETH from machine. Amount must be less than
 any unplayed bets in machine to allow for refunds.
@dev Withdraw specified amount of LINK from machine.

@dev Add any address as authorized user. Can be used to whitelist other contracts
 that may want to interact with authorized functions.

@dev Updates the address to which all withdrawals of ETH & LINK will be sent. If
 machine is closed (all funds withdrawn), this address receives all available funds.

@dev Withdraws all available funds from the machine, leaving behind only
 _unplayedBets, which must remain for any refund requests. This does not
 do anything to halt operations other than removing funding, which
 automatically disallows play. If machine is re-funded, play may continue.

@dev Used to create a LuckyMachine that can be verified and included in the
 factory list.

@dev Returns a list of all machines created from this factory. Useful to verify
 a machine was setup appropriately and is a "legitimate" LuckyMachine.
@dev Returns a list of all machines created by the sender.

betPayable(uint256).details: Returns whether a winning bet can by paid out by machine. Balance of machine must be at least (value of bet * payout).

closeMachine().details: Withdraws all available funds from the machine, leaving behind only _unplayedBets, which must remain for any refund requests. This does not do anything to halt operations other than removing funding, which automatically disallows play. If machine is re-funded, play may continue.

fulfillRandomness(bytes32,uint256[]).details: Called by Machine Coordinator only once number is generated. Gas reserves are refilled here so they can be cleared for gas savings when next bet is placed.

getSummary().details: Returns summary of machine requirements for play and payout multiplier.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

placeBetFor(address,uint256).details: Returns Game ID, which can be queried for status of game using games('gameID'). This will fail if machine conditions are not met. Use safeBetFor() if all conditions have not been pre-verified.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

replayGame(uint256).details: Option to replay any games that may have been created, but unable to complete initial play for some reason. Unplayed games may be refunded or replayed until the number has been generated and game is marked as played.

requestRefund(uint256).details: Request a refund for an unplayed game. If game is created, but machine conditions are not appropriate to allow play, no number will be generated and player or authorized address can request refund. Regardless of who requests refund, payout will always be to player listed in game.

safeBetFor(address,uint256).details: Returns Game ID, which can be queried for status of game using games('gameID'). Places bet after ensuring all conditions are met (bet within minimum - maximum range, maximum pick not exceeded, winning bet is payable).

setAuthorizedUser(address,bool).details: Add any address as authorized user. Can be used to whitelist other contracts that may want to interact with authorized functions.

setLINK(address).details: Can update LINK address if necessary. Should not have to call this, but herein case token address is updated for any reason. Can also be set to any ERC-20 token in case of other tokens inadvertently sent to contract.

setPayoutAddress(address).details: Updates the address to which all withdrawals of ETH & LINK will be sent. If machine is closed (all funds withdrawn), this address receives all available funds.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawEth(uint256).details: Withdraw specified amount of ETH from machine. Amount must be less than any unplayed bets in machine to allow for refunds.

withdrawLink(uint256).details: Withdraw specified amount of LINK from machine.
